sentence: Then king Yudhishthira, seeing that twilight had come and that king Yudhishthira own troops, slaughtered by Bhishma, had thrown aside his own troops, slaughtered by Bhishma weapons, and that stricken with fear, and turned off the field, his own troops, slaughtered by Bhishma were seeking to flee away, and beholding Bhishma also, that mighty car-warrior, excited with wrath and afflicting everybody in fight, and noticing that the mighty car-warriors of the Somakas, having been vanquished, had all become cheerless, reflected a little, and then ordered the troops to be withdrawn.

sentence: And the valiant Bhishma, having slain Satanika in battle, felled, O king, full one thousand Kshatriyas with his broad-headed shafts.
subject: Bhishma

sentence: And the valiant Bhishma, having slain Satanika in battle, felled, O king, full one thousand Kshatriyas with his broad-headed shafts.
subject: valiant Bhishma

sentence: Then Vibhatsu, drawing Vibhatsu bow Gandiva with a laugh, pierced the son of Ganga with five and twenty arrows.
subject: Vibhatsu

sentence: While Bhishma was thus speaking to Dussasana, Phalguni with sharp shafts, and placing Sikhandin to the fore, pierced Bhishma in that battle.
subject: Phalguni
object: While Bhishma was speaking to Dussasana

sentence: Bhima had vowed to slay the sons of Dhritarashtra; therefore, Abhimanyu liked not to falsify Bhima uncle's vow by Bhima slaying any of the sons of Dhritarashtra.
subject: Bhima
